title: Mastering ACI: Cisco's Data Center Revolution
prerequisites: CCNA or equivalent networking knowledge
Familiarity with data center fundamentals
Basic understanding of routing and switching protocols
description: The Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) course at Techboxx is tailored to provide comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience in configuring and managing Cisco's innovative data center architecture. ACI simplifies, optimizes, and accelerates the deployment and operations of modern data centers. This course aligns with Cisco's CCNP Data Center and CCIE Data Center certifications, making it ideal for IT professionals aiming to master ACI fundamentals and advanced features. Through a combination of theory, hands-on labs, and real-world scenarios, you will gain expertise in deploying, configuring, and troubleshooting ACI fabrics, policies, and integrations with third-party solutions.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Here's an overview:

coreConcepts.title: Introduction to Cisco ACI
coreConcepts.details: Basics of Cisco ACI architecture, its components, and the benefits it brings to modern data centers.

coreConcepts.title: Policy Model and Application Profiles
coreConcepts.details: Understand the ACI policy model, tenants, and VRFs, and how to create application profiles and endpoint groups (EPGs).

coreConcepts.title: Configuring ACI Networking Features
coreConcepts.details: VLAN pools, contracts, filters, and configuring multicast in the ACI fabric.

coreConcepts.title: Integrating ACI with External Networks
coreConcepts.details: Configure Layer 2/3 connections, integrate with legacy networks, & implement routing protocols like BGP and OSPF.

coreConcepts.title: Advanced ACI Features
coreConcepts.details: Multi-Pod and Multi-Site architectures, Remote Leaf solutions, and using service graphs for traffic redirection.

coreConcepts.title: Troubleshooting ACI Fabrics
coreConcepts.details: Learn troubleshooting methodologies, tools, and best practices to debug and maintain ACI fabric deployments.

items.title: Virtual Cisco Nexus 9000v Switches (simulating leaf and spine nodes)
Third-party virtual appliances for ACI integrations

keyFeatures: 60+ hours of live instructor-led training
80+ hours of hands-on lab exercises designed around real-world scenarios
Comprehensive lab guides and ACI configuration templates
Industry-expert trainers with extensive Cisco data center experience
Round-the-clock support to answer your queries and resolve issues
Career mentorship, certification preparation, and mock tests
Access to Techboxx's exclusive learning community
Job assistance and referrals by leveraging our expanding industry network
Course completion certificate recognized by industry leaders
whoIsThisCourseFor: Anyone seeking expertise in SDN (Software-Defined Networking) and Cisco ACI
Network engineers and architects working in data center environments
IT professionals pursuing CCNP Data Center and CCIE Data Center certifications
Organizations transitioning to a modern ACI-based data center infrastructure

title: CCNP 300-435 ENAUTO (Implementing Automation for Cisco Enterprise Solutions)
prerequisites: CCNA or equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: As enterprise networks grow more complex, manual configuration becomes prone to errors and inefficiencies. The CCNP ENAUTO course teaches you how to automate repetitive tasks, reducing human error and freeing up valuable time for more strategic initiatives. Automating your network is no longer an option; it's a necessity to keep your operations running smoothly. You'll gain real-world experience with Cisco's DNA Center, vManage, Meraki, and other automation platforms, ensuring you're ready to implement solutions in actual enterprise environments.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The following highlights the topics in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Network Programmability Foundation
coreConcepts.details: Version control with Git, Python programming basics, and API styles like REST and RPC

coreConcepts.title: Automate APIs and Protocols
coreConcepts.details: Utilizing YANG models and comparing protocols like NETCONF and RESTCONF for automation

coreConcepts.title: Network Device Programmability
coreConcepts.details: Use of Python, Ansible, and RESTCONF for device configuration and telemetry setup

coreConcepts.title: Cisco DNA Center
coreConcepts.details: Automating and managing networks using Cisco DNA Center's APIs

coreConcepts.title: Cisco SD-WAN
coreConcepts.details: Automating Cisco SD-WAN solutions using vManage APIs

coreConcepts.title: Cisco Meraki
coreConcepts.details: Meraki automation with API integrations for network management and monitoring

items.title: Other tools
items.details: Git, Docker, Linux, and VS Code

keyFeatures: 55+ hours of dynamic instructor-led training
120+ hours in hands-on labs, modelled on real-world network scenarios
CCNP ENAUTO lab manual & guide (50+ labs & superlabs included)
Industry-expert trainers and professionals, with 15+ years of global experience
Personalized mentorship and career guidance
Both real-world and certification-focused preparation, including mock tests
Access to Techboxx's learning community and CCNP ENAUTO resources
Course completion certificate
whoIsThisCourseFor: Individuals pursuing the Cisco Certified DevNet Professional certification, or those looking to enhance their qualifications with a focus on automation
Anyone looking to specialize in network automation and programmability, with a focus on automating tasks across various Cisco platforms
Engineers who want to make their networks more efficient, scalable, and easier to manage through automation
Individuals working in DevOps who need to integrate networking automation into continuous deployment and development environments

title: Cisco Certified Design Expert
prerequisites: Deep understanding of routing and switching protocols
Strong knowledge of security and cloud domains
CCIE or 5+ years of experience is recommended
description: Master the art of network design with the Cisco Certified Design Expert (CCDE) certification, one of the highest credentials in the networking industry. Offered by Techboxx, this course equips senior networking professionals with the expertise to design scalable, secure, and innovative networks that align with business goals and industry demands. Covering advanced concepts, participants will learn to translate technical and business requirements into robust solutions for enterprise and service provider environments. Achieving the CCDE requires passing the Cisco CCDE v3.1 unified exam, a testament to your ability to craft cutting-edge network designs and strategies.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The CCDE v3.1 exam comprises five modules:

coreConcepts.title: Business Strategy Design
coreConcepts.details: Understand the impact of business strategies on network design, implementation, and optimization, considering methodologies like waterfall and agile.

coreConcepts.title: Control, Data, Management Plane, and Operational Design
coreConcepts.details: Analyze end-to-end IP traffic flow and design data, control, and management plane technologies, including automation and software-defined architectures.

coreConcepts.title: Network Design
coreConcepts.details: Develop resilient, scalable, and secure modular networks, addressing technical, operational, application, and business requirements, along with implementation and migration plans.

coreConcepts.title: Service Design
coreConcepts.details: Design network services to support applications such as voice, video, IoT, and cloud solutions, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and security considerations.

coreConcepts.title: Security Design
coreConcepts.details: Integrate network security measures, including segmentation, access control, visibility, policy enforcement, and compliance with regulations, to protect data integrity and confidentiality.

items.title: Cisco dCloud for accessing pre-configured topologies
AWS or Azure environments to simulate cloud-integration designs

keyFeatures: 120+ hours of live instructor-led training
200+ hours of hands-on practice
Industry-expert trainers and professionals, with 15+ years of global experience
CCDE training resources and manuals
Round-the-clock support to answer your queries and resolve issues
Access to Techboxx's exclusive learning community
Course completion certificate
whoIsThisCourseFor: Senior network engineers seeking advanced design expertise
Network architects aiming to align designs with business strategies
Professionals looking to achieve the prestigious Cisco CCDE certification

title: Mastering Python for Network Engineers
prerequisites: CCNP or equivalent networking knowledge
Familiarity with Firewalls and VPNs
Familiarity with Routing and Switching protocols
Familiarity with IP Services
description: The Mastering Python for Network Engineers course at Techboxx is designed for network professionals who want to automate and streamline network management using Python. Combining core Python programming concepts with network automation, the course teaches you to automate repetitive tasks, configure network devices, and troubleshoot more efficiently. You'll gain hands-on experience using powerful Python libraries like Netmiko, Paramiko, and NAPALM for tasks such as device configuration, routing, switching, and VPN setup. This course is ideal for network engineers and IT professionals looking to enhance their productivity and network reliability through automation. By the end, you'll be equipped to write Python scripts that improve operational consistency and reduce manual intervention in network management.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Here's an overview:

coreConcepts.title: Programming Basics
coreConcepts.details: Foundational Python concepts needed for network automation, ensuring you have the necessary skills to write effective Python scripts.

coreConcepts.title: Automating Basic Networking Tasks
coreConcepts.details: Using Python to automate common network tasks such as device configuration, backup, and basic communication protocols.

coreConcepts.title: Routing Protocols
coreConcepts.details: Automate configurations for key routing protocols such as EIGRP, OSPF, and BGP using Python.

coreConcepts.title: Switching
coreConcepts.details: Automating switch configurations, such as VLAN management, security protocols, and port configurations.

coreConcepts.title: IP Services
coreConcepts.details: Automate common IP services configurations like HSRP, VRRP, and DHCP using Python scripts.

coreConcepts.title: VPN Configurations
coreConcepts.details: Automate various VPN configurations, such as IPsec and DMVPN, using Python to ensure secure communications.

coreConcepts.title: ASA Firewall
coreConcepts.details: Automate configurations on ASA firewalls, including NAT and ACLs for enhanced security.

coreConcepts.title: MPLS Configurations
coreConcepts.details: Automate MPLS configurations and related protocols to optimize routing and traffic management.

items.title: Cisco Webex Teams for Network Automation

keyFeatures: 60+ hours of live instructor-led training
70+ hours of hands-on lab exercises designed to simulate real-world scenarios
Comprehensive Python scripts and templates for network automation tasks
Expert trainers with in-depth knowledge of Python programming and networking
Round-the-clock support to answer your queries and resolve issues
Access to Techboxx's exclusive learning community
Course completion certificate recognized by industry leaders
whoIsThisCourseFor: IT professionals transitioning into network automation roles
Organizations seeking to enhance network management efficiency
Anyone interested in combining Python programming with networking expertise

title: CCNP Data Center
prerequisites: CCNA and CCNP Enterprise level of knowledge is required.
description: Techboxx brings you an industry-focused CCNP Data Center program that goes beyond theory. You'll configure multi-pod ACI fabrics, manage UCS compute pools, and deploy HyperFlex clusters in hands-on workshops. Dive into orchestration with Cisco NSO and develop custom automation routines in Python. Troubleshoot performance bottlenecks and secure east-west traffic with micro-segmentation. Complete capstone labs that simulate large-scale deployments and earn the skills to excel in any data center role.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The CCNP DC core paper (DCCOR), and one of the CCNP Data Center concentration papers.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 350-601 DCCOR
coreConcepts.details: Master core Cisco Data Center technologies, optimizing network infrastructure for performance and scalability.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-610 DCID
coreConcepts.details: Learn to design robust, scalable Cisco data center networks that meet business needs and ensure security.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-615 DCIT
coreConcepts.details: Develop troubleshooting skills to quickly resolve data center issues and ensure smooth, uninterrupted operations.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-620 DCACI
coreConcepts.details: Implement Cisco's Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) to create agile, automated, and secure data center solutions.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-630 DCACIA
coreConcepts.details: Advance your ACI skills to optimize, deploy, and troubleshoot high-performance data center networks.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-635 DCAUTO
coreConcepts.details: Automate Cisco data center operations using programming and scripting to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.

items.title: Cisco UCS B-Series Blade & C-Series Rack Servers
Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) & ACI Simulator
Cisco DevNet Sandbox for Data Center (Remote Lab Access)
Bash / PowerShell CLI (Server & Network Automation Interfaces)

Infrastructure architects and engineers responsible for designing, deploying, and maintaining enterprise data centers
Systems and storage administrators moving into converged infrastructure roles

IT managers and consultants aiming to lead large-scale, multi-site data center projects
Anyone preparing for the Cisco CCNP Data Center certification and looking to gain hands-on expertise with Nexus, UCS, HyperFlex, and ACI environments

title: CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure
prerequisites: CCNA and CCNP Enterprise equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: Ready to join the top 1% of network professionals? Techboxx's CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure training immerses you in realistic network crises, sharpens your troubleshooting agility, and refines your design thinking. Guided by seasoned trainers, you'll learn to think on your feet, craft elegant solutions under time constraints, and communicate complex ideas clearly. This blend of intense practice, direct mentorship, and performance reviews primes you for exam success, and positions you as an indispensable asset in any large-scale IT team.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure (EI) certification exam is structured into five modules, each focusing on a specific area of expertise:

coreConcepts.title: Network Infrastructure
coreConcepts.details: Advanced routing, switching, multicast, and QoS technologies to design, deploy, and troubleshoot modern enterprise networks.

coreConcepts.title: Software-Defined Infrastructure
coreConcepts.details: Cisco SD-WAN, SD-Access, and programmable network concepts, including automation and orchestration.

coreConcepts.title: Transport Technologies and Solutions
coreConcepts.details: MPLS, VPNs, Segment Routing, and other technologies for scalable and secure network transport solutions.

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure Security and Services
coreConcepts.details: Secure network design, firewalls, AAA, and critical infrastructure services like HSRP, DHCP, DNS, and NTP.

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure Automation and Programmability
coreConcepts.details: Network automation tools, APIs, Python scripting, and model-driven programmability for efficient network operations.

keyFeatures: 160+ hours of live instructor-led training
300+ hours of hands-on lab practice, including design, configuration, and troubleshooting tasks, modelled on real-world network scenarios
CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure lab manual & guide, including super labs
Industry-expert trainers and professionals, with 15+ years of global experience
Personalized mentorship and career guidance
Both real-world and certification-focused preparation, including mock tests
Access to Techboxx's learning community and CCIE EI resources
Course completion certificate
whoIsThisCourseFor: Ambitious freshers and recent graduates with strong CCNP-level knowledge who want to fast-track into enterprise networking roles
Engineers aiming to earn the prestigious CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure certification and secure top-tier network positions
Senior network engineers and architects looking to deepen their expertise in large-scale environments
Automation and DevOps practitioners eager to integrate Python, Ansible, and Cisco DNA Center into their workflows
IT leaders and consultants responsible for designing, deploying, and troubleshooting mission-critical campus and WAN fabrics

title: CCNP Enterprise
prerequisites: CCNA level of networking knowledge is required.
description: CCNP Enterprise at Techboxx is a guided, high-impact program that makes you confident in real enterprise networks. You'll dive deep into advanced routing, switching, security, and automation---step by step. We skip the fluff, go deep into the real stuff, and help you build confidence to work in big network environments. We focus on clarity, and job readiness. It's for learners who want to do more, earn more, and grow faster.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  To earn this certification, you'll need to pass two exams: a core exam (ENCOR), and one of the CCNP Enterprise concentration exams

coreConcepts.title: ENCOR
coreConcepts.details: You'll build a strong foundation in core networking topics like routing, switching, wireless, and security. By the end, you'll know how to set up, manage, and troubleshoot modern enterprise networks.

coreConcepts.title: ENARSI
coreConcepts.details: This course dives into advanced routing protocols like OSPF, EIGRP, and BGP. You'll also learn how to troubleshoot and secure your network's routing infrastructure effectively.

coreConcepts.title: ENSDWI
coreConcepts.details: Learn how to implement and manage Cisco SD-WAN solutions to ensure secure and efficient connectivity. It's all about simplifying network management while boosting performance.

coreConcepts.title: ENSLD
coreConcepts.details: This course focuses on designing enterprise networks that are secure, scalable, and reliable. You'll learn practical strategies for redundancy, QoS, and virtualization.

coreConcepts.title: ENAUTO
coreConcepts.details: Get hands-on with network automation using Python, APIs, and Cisco tools. You'll learn how to automate repetitive tasks and manage networks more efficiently.

whoIsThisCourseFor: Network professionals who have completed CCNA and want to advance their enterprise networking expertise
Aspiring professionals looking to build careers in Networking, Cybersecurity, Cloud Computing, or Network Automation, as this course provides essential foundational knowledge
Career-focused individuals targeting positions such as Network Engineer, Solutions Architect, or Infrastructure Specialist
Certification seekers preparing for the CCNP Enterprise exam and practical network implementation scenarios
Career transitioners with fundamental networking knowledge seeking to advance to mid-to-senior level network positions

title: CCIE Data Center
prerequisites: CCNP Data Center level of knowledge.
description: Master the art of large-scale computing with Techboxx's CCIE Data Center program. Our focused labs and expert guidance help you think like a data center architect: anticipating issues, automating solutions, and delivering resilient designs. You'll navigate real infrastructure challenges, refine your scripting and automation skills, and build the leadership mindset to drive major projects. You'll walk away exam-ready and truly industry-ready.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The CCIE Data Center exam consists of eight modules that assess DC expertise in different scenarios:

coreConcepts.title: Data Center Architecture & Foundations
coreConcepts.details: Spine-leaf designs and virtualization fundamentals that power modern data centers.

coreConcepts.title: Cisco ACI Fundamentals
coreConcepts.details: Intent-based policies and endpoint groups to automate fabric operations.

coreConcepts.title: Nexus Switching & Fabric Deployment
coreConcepts.details: Build and scale high-performance Nexus spine-leaf topologies.

coreConcepts.title: UCS Compute & Server Virtualization
coreConcepts.details: Configure UCS servers and service profiles for automated compute provisioning.

coreConcepts.title: HyperFlex & Storage Integration
coreConcepts.details: Deploy HyperFlex clusters and manage distributed storage for hyper converged environments.

coreConcepts.title: Automation & Programmability
coreConcepts.details: Automate workflows with Python, Ansible, and Cisco DevNet APIs.

coreConcepts.title: Multi-Site & High Availability
coreConcepts.details: Design multi-pod/multi-site ACI fabrics and implement disaster-recovery strategies.

coreConcepts.title: Advanced Troubleshooting & Exam Prep
coreConcepts.details: Tackle timed lab scenarios and master exam techniques for CCIE success.

items.title: Cisco UCS B-Series Blade & C-Series Rack Servers (UCS Manager)
Cisco HyperFlex HX Data Platform (Hyperconverged Storage & Compute)
Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) Hardware (APIC Controllers & Leaf/Spine Switches)
Cisco MDS 9000 Series Storage Switches (Fibre Channel SAN)
Cisco UCS Platform Emulator (Virtual UCS Manager)
Cisco ACI Multi-Site Simulator (Virtual Multi-Pod/Multi-Site Fabric)
DevNet Sandbox for Data Center (Cloud-Hosted Lab Access)
Cisco DevNet Code Exchange (APIs & Sample Scripts)

title: CCNP 350-401 ENCOR (Implementing Cisco Enterprise Network Core Technologies)
prerequisites: CCNA or equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: If you're looking to advance your networking career and stay ahead in the rapidly evolving tech landscape, the CCNP ENCOR 350-401 course offers the perfect solution. From configuring and troubleshooting complex enterprise networks to implementing advanced solutions like SD-WAN and network automation, this course covers the essential networking skills you need. This course is a core requirement for the CCNP Enterprise and prepares you for advanced certifications like CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The following highlights the topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Architecture
coreConcepts.details: Enterprise network design models and how to implement modern architectures like SD-WAN and SD-Access

coreConcepts.title: Virtualization
coreConcepts.details: Network virtualization techniques, including VPNs, GRE tunnels, and LISP

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure
coreConcepts.details: Master Layer 2 and Layer 3 technologies, including VLANs, OSPF, BGP, and network services like SNMP and IP SLA

coreConcepts.title: Network Assurance
coreConcepts.details: Network visibility, proactive monitoring, and troubleshooting with tools like Cisco DNA Center

coreConcepts.title: Security
coreConcepts.details: Implement robust enterprise security measures, including AAA, VPNs, and device hardening practices

coreConcepts.title: Automation
coreConcepts.details: Network automation through programmability with Python, NETCONF, RESTCONF, and APIs in Cisco DNA Center and vManage

title: BGP, MPLS & IS-IS: Essential to Expert
prerequisites: CCNP level of routing knowledge is required.
description: Take your networking skills to the next level with Techboxx's BGP, MPLS & IS-IS: Essential to Expert course. Designed for those who want to understand and implement advanced networking protocols, this course covers BGP for internet routing, MPLS for traffic management, and IS-IS for service provider environments. This course will teach you how to design, implement, and troubleshoot networks using these critical protocols. By the end, you'll feel confident handling enterprise and service provider networks, and ready to apply your knowledge in complex environments. Start mastering these vital networking skills today and take the next step in your networking career!

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Here's an overview:

coreConcepts.title: BGP
coreConcepts.details: IBGP vs EBGP, BGP Attributes, Peering & Neighbor Relationships, Path Selection, Route Filtering & Policy Implementation, Security, Route Aggregation, Confederations & Route Reflectors, Authentication, Route Filtration, BGP for MPLS Integration, Scalability & Optimization

coreConcepts.title: MPLS
coreConcepts.details: Architecture, VPNs, Traffic Engineering, QoS Implementation, Security, MPLS with BGP for VPN Routing, MPLS in Service Provider Networks, Label Distribution, Protocols, Design and Scalability Techniques, Troubleshooting

coreConcepts.title: IS-IS
coreConcepts.details: Protocol Basics, Configuration, Level 1 (Intra-area) and Level 2 (Inter-area) Routing, Area Design and Scalability, IS-IS Integration with MPLS, Authentication, Troubleshooting, Performance Optimization

items.title: Server for hosting software emulation programs
EVE-NG, GNS3 / Cisco VIRL (for virtual network simulation)
Cisco vEdge Routers (Virtualized Routers for MPLS/BGP configurations)

title: CCNP 300-415 ENSDWI (Implementing Cisco SD-WAN Solutions)
prerequisites: CCNA or equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: In today's fast-paced digital landscape, businesses are increasingly adopting SD-WAN solutions to optimize their network performance. The CCNP 300-415 ENSDWI course equips you with the skills to design, implement, and manage Cisco SD-WAN solutions, making you a valuable asset in any organization. This course is not just a credential; it's a testament to your commitment to staying relevant in the ever-evolving field of networking.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The following highlights the topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: SD-WAN Architecture
coreConcepts.details: Overall structure of Cisco SD-WAN, including components like vManage, vSmart, and vBond

coreConcepts.title: Controller Deployment
coreConcepts.details: Deploy and configure SD-WAN controllers, ensuring secure and efficient management of the WAN

coreConcepts.title: Edge Router Deployment
coreConcepts.details: Deploy physical and virtual routers (cEdge and vEdge) in the SD-WAN environment

coreConcepts.title: Policies
coreConcepts.details: Create and manage application-aware routing and data policies for efficient traffic management

coreConcepts.title: Security
coreConcepts.details: Security implementations within SD-WAN, including integrated firewalls and intrusion prevention systems

coreConcepts.title: Quality of Service (QoS)
coreConcepts.details: Configure QoS settings to optimize network performance and application delivery

coreConcepts.title: Multicast
coreConcepts.details: Implement multicast routing within the SD-WAN architecture

coreConcepts.title: Management and Operations
coreConcepts.details: Ongoing management, monitoring, and operational tasks necessary for maintaining a robust SD-WAN deployment

items.title: Cisco vEdge Routers (Virtualized SD-WAN Edge Routers)

title: CCNP Service Provider
prerequisites: CCNA
description: Service providers run the world's networks and connect millions by providing internet backbone services spanning across cities and countries. Techboxx's CCNP SP training helps you build specialized skills to design, deploy, secure, and troubleshoot large-scale carrier networks that make modern communication possible. Whether you're aiming for roles in ISPs, telecom or enterprise WAN teams, this course equips you with skills that will be in demand everywhere. Get trained, get recognized, and get ahead.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  To earn this certification, you'll need to pass two exams: a core exam (SPCOR), and one of the CCNP Service Provider concentration exams.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 350-501 SPCOR
coreConcepts.details: Learn the key technologies that keep service provider networks running, like automation, security, and QoS. This course gives you the skills to build and manage networks that scale.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-510 SPRI
coreConcepts.details: Take your routing expertise to the next level with advanced protocols like MPLS and segment routing. You'll learn how to optimize and troubleshoot complex service provider networks.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-515 SPVI
coreConcepts.details: Become an expert in delivering secure and reliable VPN services. This course teaches you how to implement MPLS L3VPN, L2VPN, and other technologies to support enterprise connectivity.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-540 SPCNI
coreConcepts.details: Learn how to design and set up modern cloud-based networks for service providers. With a focus on SDN and NFV, you'll gain the skills to tackle today's cloud networking challenges.

coreConcepts.title: CCNP 300-535 SPAUTO
coreConcepts.details: Automate and streamline service provider operations with tools like Python and APIs. This course helps you save time and make networks more efficient and reliable.

items.title: Routers and switches running Cisco IOS XE - Cisco Catalyst 9000 series

ISP and telco professionals responsible for MPLS, BGP, QoS, and large-scale WAN deployments.

title: Cisco Certified Network Associate
prerequisites: No prerequisites. No prior knowledge in IT or networking is required.
description: Want to work in networking, cybersecurity, or cloud computing? Start with Techboxx's high-intensity CCNA certification training program. From mastering networking fundamentals to unlocking the secrets of automation and security, our course equips you with the skills to manage and optimise the most advanced networks. With focus on hands-on labs, real-world applications and expert mentorship, you'll be confident, job-ready, and interview-prepared.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The following highlights the modules covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Network Fundamentals
coreConcepts.details: Understand basic networking concepts, including the OSI model, IP addressing, and Ethernet technologies.

coreConcepts.title: Network Access
coreConcepts.details: Learn about switching concepts, VLANs, trunking, and wireless networking principles.

coreConcepts.title: IP Connectivity
coreConcepts.details: Explore routing concepts, static and dynamic routing (EIGRP, OSPF), and inter-VLAN routing.

coreConcepts.title: IP Services
coreConcepts.details: Configure and verify network services like NAT, DHCP, NTP, HSRP and DNS.

coreConcepts.title: Security Fundamentals
coreConcepts.details: Gain insights into network security principles, access control lists (ACLs), and secure device access.

coreConcepts.title: Automation and Programmability
coreConcepts.details: Introduction to network automation, APIs, and the basics of programmability.

keyFeatures: 60+ hours of dynamic instructor-led training
100+ hours in hands-on labs, modelled on real-world network scenarios.
CCNA lab manual & guide (60+ labs & superlabs included).
Training by certified network and security experts with real-world corporate experience.
Personalized mentorship and career guidance.
Access to Techboxx's learning community and CCNA resources.
Resume and interview coaching.
Course completion certificate.
whoIsThisCourseFor: College students or graduates trying to enter the tech field
Anyone who wants to build a career in the Networking industry
Anyone who wants to build a career in Cybersecurity, Cloud or Automation. This course lays a strong foundation and acts as a prerequisite for these domains.
Beginners or college/university students that belong to any academic background.
IT or non-IT professionals, who want to start a career in Networking, Security or Cloud.

title: CCIE Service Provider
prerequisites: CCNA and CCNP SP trained or equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: Ready to solve the toughest carrier network puzzles? Techboxx's CCIE Service Provider course pairs you with industry veterans for deep-dive lab sessions and exam-style drills. You'll develop tactical troubleshooting abilities, strategic planning skills, and the poise to handle real-world outages: : all while preparing thoroughly for your CCIE lab to secure your place among the world's top network professionals.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The CCIE Service Provider (SP) v5.1 exam is divided into six modules, covering key technologies in service provider networks. Here's a brief overview:

coreConcepts.title: Core Routing
coreConcepts.details: Focuses on advanced BGP, OSPF, and IS-IS protocols for large-scale service provider routing architectures and inter-AS operations.

coreConcepts.title: Service Provider Architecture and Services
coreConcepts.details: Covers MPLS, L2/L3 VPNs, Segment Routing, and multicast technologies for scalable and secure service provider solutions.

coreConcepts.title: Access and Aggregation
coreConcepts.details: Addresses Ethernet, broadband, and optical network technologies used in access and aggregation layers of SP networks.

coreConcepts.title: High Availability and Fast Convergence
coreConcepts.details: Explores technologies like MPLS-TE, FRR, and network resilience techniques to ensure reliability and minimal downtime.

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure Security
coreConcepts.details: Focuses on SP-specific security mechanisms like RTBH, uRPF, BGP Flowspec, and AAA to protect the infrastructure.

coreConcepts.title: Network Automation and Assurance
coreConcepts.details: Emphasizes programmability, telemetry, Python scripting, and tools like NetConf/RestConf for automating SP network operations.

items.title: Cisco NCS 5500 Series Routers (core and edge platforms)
Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers (aggregation and edge services)
Cisco IOS XR for routing and MPLS functionality.
Cisco IOS XE Virtual (CSR 1000v) for network edge and service configurations.
Cisco Nexus 9000v for data center interconnection scenarios in SP networks.
Python and Ansible for network automation, scripting, and configuration.
YANG Models used with NETCONF/RESTCONF for programmability.
Cisco DevNet Tools for practicing automation and testing APIs.
iPerf and Scapy for traffic generation and network performance testing.
Wireshark for packet analysis and troubleshooting.

keyFeatures: 160+ hours of live instructor-led training for in-depth theoretical coverage and module explanations.
300+ hours of hands-on lab practice, including design, configuration, and troubleshooting tasks, modelled on real-world network scenarios.
CCIE Service Provider lab manual & guide
Industry-expert trainers and professionals, with 15+ years of global experience.
Personalized mentorship and career guidance.
Both real-world and certification-focused preparation, including mock tests.
Access to Techboxx's learning community and CCIE SP resources.
Course completion certificate.
whoIsThisCourseFor: Recent graduates and ambitious freshers with solid networking fundamentals seeking to accelerate their careers in service provider environments
Network engineers and architects looking to expand their expertise in carrier-grade network infrastructures
ISP and telecom professionals managing large-scale WAN design, deployment, and troubleshooting
Automation and DevOps specialists interested in implementing Python, Ansible, and network orchestration tools in service provider workflows
IT leaders and consultants focused on maintaining high availability, performance, and SLAs in service provider networks
Professionals preparing for CCIE Service Provider certification who want practical experience with real-world carrier network challenges

title: CCNP 300-410 ENARSI (Implementing Cisco Enterprise Advanced Routing and Services)
prerequisites: CCNA or equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: In a rapidly evolving tech landscape, staying ahead is crucial. The CCNP 300-410 ENARSI course empowers you with the latest routing technologies and security best practices, ensuring you're ready for the challenges of modern enterprise environments. This course covers critical areas like infrastructure security, advanced VPN services, and high availability solutions. With this certification training, you'll demonstrate your expertise to potential employers and increase your earning potential in the competitive IT job market.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The following highlights the topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Layer 3 Technologies
coreConcepts.details: Advanced routing protocols such as EIGRP, OSPF, and BGP, focusing on configuration, troubleshooting, and route manipulation

coreConcepts.title: VPN Technologies
coreConcepts.details: Implement and manage various VPN technologies, including DMVPN and MPLS, to secure site-to-site communications

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure Security
coreConcepts.details: Security measures for enterprise networks, utilizing AAA protocols, ACLs, and CoPP to safeguard network devices

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure Services
coreConcepts.details: Essential services like DHCP, SNMP, and IP SLA that enhance network performance and monitoring capabilities

coreConcepts.title: Infrastructure Automation
coreConcepts.details: Automation techniques and tools to streamline network management and improve operational efficiency

title: SD-WAN: Basics to Advanced Mastery
prerequisites: CCNA level of networking knowledge
Familiarity with BGP, OSPF, and MPLS
Understanding of VPNs & basic security
Basic knowledge of WAN technologies
description: At Techboxx, we understand that mastering SD-WAN is more than just learning a technology; it's about transforming your career and empowering you to lead in the evolving world of networking. Our SD-WAN: Basics to Advanced Mastery course is meticulously crafted to take you from the basics to advanced concepts, ensuring you gain a comprehensive understanding of SD-WAN architecture, deployment strategies, and management techniques. Through engaging lessons, hands-on labs, and real-world scenarios, you'll develop the skills to design, deploy, and manage secure, scalable SD-WAN solutions with confidence. Whether you're new to SD-WAN or looking to enhance your expertise, Techboxx is here to guide you every step of the way. Let's go beyond learning: let's redefine what's possible with SD-WAN.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Here's an overview:

coreConcepts.title: SD-WAN Architecture
coreConcepts.details: Orchestration, Management, Control, and Data planes

coreConcepts.title: Cisco SD-WAN Edge Platforms
coreConcepts.details: Explore SD-WAN Edge capabilities and features

coreConcepts.title: Cisco SD-WAN Cloud OnRamp
coreConcepts.details: Integrating SD-WAN with cloud services: SaaS, IaaS, and more

coreConcepts.title: Controller Deployment
coreConcepts.details: Deploy SD-WAN controllers in both cloud and on-premises environments

coreConcepts.title: WAN Edge Deployment
coreConcepts.details: Configuring and deploying WAN Edge devices in various environments

coreConcepts.title: Cisco SD-WAN Data Plane
coreConcepts.details: Managing circuit termination, TLOC extension, and connectivity

coreConcepts.title: Overlay Management Protocol (OMP)
coreConcepts.details: Key concepts in OMP, including route management and IPsec

coreConcepts.title: Configuration Templates
coreConcepts.details: Efficiently create and manage device and configuration templates

coreConcepts.title: SD-WAN Policies
coreConcepts.details: Configure control and data policies, segmentation, and routing

coreConcepts.title: Security Features in SD-WAN
coreConcepts.details: Implement security features like firewalls, URL filtering, and cloud integration

coreConcepts.title: Quality of Service (QoS)
coreConcepts.details: Optimize traffic with scheduling, queuing, and QoS settings

coreConcepts.title: Management and Monitoring
coreConcepts.details: Manage SD-WAN through vManage, including monitoring and reporting

items.title: Cisco vEdge Routers (Virtualized SD-WAN Edge Routers)

title: CCNP 300-420 ENSLD (Designing Cisco Enterprise Networks)
prerequisites: CCNA or equivalent level of networking knowledge is required.
description: With technologies like SD-WAN, IoT, and cloud reshaping how networks operate, the CCNP 300-420 ENSLD course teaches you to design for modern needs. You'll learn how to integrate new technologies into traditional architectures, creating flexible and scalable solutions that meet the demands of today's enterprises. This course, combined with other modules, positions you for success by opening the door to advanced roles like Network Architect, Senior Network Engineer, and more.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  The following highlights the topics in this course:

coreConcepts.title: EIGRP, OSPF, IS-IS, and BGP Routing Designs
coreConcepts.details: Scalable and resilient designs for large-scale enterprise networks

coreConcepts.title: Enterprise Campus LAN Design
coreConcepts.details: VLAN designs, access layers, and routing strategies for enterprise campus networks

coreConcepts.title: Layer 2 and Layer 3 Campus Design
coreConcepts.details: VLANs, trunking, spanning tree protocols, and Layer 2 security techniques. Covers benefits of routing at the access layer, convergence, and summarization

coreConcepts.title: Cisco SD-Access Architecture
coreConcepts.details: Components, benefits, and design of Cisco's Software-Defined Access

coreConcepts.title: Service Provider and Enterprise VPN Designs
coreConcepts.details: MPLS VPN and WAN connectivity designs using routing protocols. Designs for GRE, IPsec, DMVPN, & more

coreConcepts.title: WAN Resiliency
coreConcepts.details: Resilient WAN design options and techniques like MPLS and traffic engineering

coreConcepts.title: Cisco SD-WAN Architecture and Deployment
coreConcepts.details: SD-WAN components, cloud, and service provider deployment models

items.title: vManage, vBond, vSmart (for SD-WAN architecture testing)
IOSv and IOSvL2 for layer 3 and layer 2 testing

title: CEHv13 with AI (Certified Ethical Hacker + Artificial Intelligence)
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of networking and operating systems
Familiarity with Linux and command-line tools is recommended
No prior cybersecurity experience required, but helpful
description: CEH v13 is one of the most recognized certifications in ethical hacking. With added modules on AI-driven security and threat detection, this course trains you to think like a hacker and defend against complex cyberattacks. You'll gain deep insights into reconnaissance, system hacking, web application attacks, and how AI is transforming the cybersecurity landscape. This course prepares you for real-world penetration testing roles and helps you stay ahead in the evolving field of cyber offense and defense.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Key topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Information Security & Ethical Hacking Overview
coreConcepts.details: Threat landscapes, attack vectors, and the role of an ethical hacker

coreConcepts.title: Reconnaissance & Footprinting
coreConcepts.details: Techniques for passive and active intelligence gathering

coreConcepts.title: Scanning & Enumeration
coreConcepts.details: Network scanning tools, banner grabbing, and vulnerability identification

coreConcepts.title: System Hacking & Malware Threats
coreConcepts.details: Password cracking, privilege escalation, and backdoors

coreConcepts.title: Web Application Hacking
coreConcepts.details: SQLi, XSS, CSRF, file inclusion, and authentication bypass

coreConcepts.title: Wireless Network Attacks
coreConcepts.details: Wi-Fi hacking, rogue APs, and wireless sniffing

coreConcepts.title: Social Engineering & Insider Threats
coreConcepts.details: Phishing, baiting, and human-based attack techniques

coreConcepts.title: AI in Cybersecurity
coreConcepts.details: How AI is used in threat detection, behavioral analysis, and automated response

coreConcepts.title: IDS/IPS Evasion, Honeypots & Firewalls
coreConcepts.details: Bypass techniques and intrusion evasion

coreConcepts.title: Cloud Security & IoT Hacking
coreConcepts.details: Modern environments like AWS, Azure, and IoT frameworks

coreConcepts.title: Report Writing & Remediation
coreConcepts.details: Impactful assessment reports and mitigation strategies

items.title: Kali Linux, Metasploit, Nmap, Burp Suite
AI-enabled SIEM tools like Splunk with ML add-ons
ChatGPT/AI prompt engineering for red teaming
Cloud-based labs via EC-Council iLabs & EVE-NG

keyFeatures: 70+ hours of instructor-led training
120+ lab exercises based on real-world attack scenarios
EC-Council CEH v13 lab manual and exam blueprint coverage
AI cybersecurity module included (with practical exercises)

title: CompTIA Security+
prerequisites: Basic understanding of networking, hardware, and software
Prior CompTIA Network+ or CCNA or equivalent knowledge is helpful
No cybersecurity experience required
description: CompTIA Security+ is a globally recognized foundational cybersecurity certification, ideal for individuals beginning a career in IT security. This course equips you with essential knowledge and hands-on skills required to secure networks, identify threats, manage risks, and respond to incidents. With a strong emphasis on practical security problem-solving, Security+ helps you build a solid baseline for advanced certifications and roles in cybersecurity operations, governance, and compliance.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Key topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Security Fundamentals
coreConcepts.details: Core concepts like CIA triad, threat actors, and types of attacks

coreConcepts.title: Risk Management & Compliance
coreConcepts.details: Risk mitigation strategies, governance, and compliance frameworks

coreConcepts.title: Identity & Access Management
coreConcepts.details: AAA protocols, multi-factor authentication, and directory services

coreConcepts.title: Network Security
coreConcepts.details: Secure network architecture, implement secure protocols, and configure firewalls

coreConcepts.title: Cryptography & PKI
coreConcepts.details: Encryption types, key management, and certificate-based security

coreConcepts.title: Security Operations
coreConcepts.details: Monitoring, incident response, disaster recovery, and logging

coreConcepts.title: Application, Host & Cloud Security
coreConcepts.details: Security controls for software, endpoints, containers, and cloud platforms

coreConcepts.title: Social Engineering & Physical Security
coreConcepts.details: Psychological attacks and physical breaches

items.title: Security Onion / ELK for log monitoring
Identity management platforms (FreeIPA / Azure AD demo)

Full coverage of the CompTIA SY0-701 exam objectives

title: CCNA CyberOps
prerequisites: Basic understanding of networking (CCNA-level knowledge recommended)
No prior cybersecurity experience needed
description: In today's threat-heavy digital landscape, organizations need skilled defenders more than ever. The CCNA CyberOps course prepares you to operate efficiently as a security analyst in a Security Operations Center (SOC). It equips you with the core knowledge of security concepts, monitoring, host-based and network analysis, and incident response. With this certification, you'll be ready to launch a cybersecurity career, take on SOC roles, and strengthen your expertise in defending enterprise environments.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Key topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Security Concepts
coreConcepts.details: Basic principles like CIA triad, threat actors, attack types, and risk management

coreConcepts.title: Security Monitoring
coreConcepts.details: How to monitor network traffic, analyze logs, and identify signs of malicious activity using SIEM tools

coreConcepts.title: Host-Based Analysis
coreConcepts.details: Endpoint security, operating system logs, malware behavior, and threat detection techniques

coreConcepts.title: Network Intrusion Analysis
coreConcepts.details: Analyzing packet captures and flow data to detect threats using tools like Wireshark

coreConcepts.title: Security Policies & Procedures
coreConcepts.details: Foundations of incident response, forensics basics, compliance, and handling security events

items.title: Linux & Windows VMs (for log analysis and malware behavior testing)
Security Onion / ELK Stack (for SOC-style monitoring)

title: CompTIA CySA+
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of networking, security, and system administration
CCNA, CCNA CyberOps or CompTIA Security+ or equivalent experience is recommended, but not mandatory
description: As cyber threats evolve, so must the defenders. CompTIA CySA+ is a performance-based certification that focuses on applying behavioral analytics to networks and devices to prevent, detect, and combat cybersecurity threats. This course prepares you to take on intermediate-level roles in security analytics, incident response, and vulnerability management. CySA+ validates your ability to proactively defend and continuously improve the security of an enterprise networkmaking you a critical asset to any cybersecurity team.

whatYouLearn.description: What you will learn:  Key topics covered in this course:

coreConcepts.title: Threat and Vulnerability Management
coreConcepts.details: Identify and assess threats, analyze vulnerability scan results, and recommend remediation strategies

coreConcepts.title: Security Operations and Monitoring

coreConcepts.title: Security Architecture and Tool Sets
